title: Magnetic field - point between two wires

content.question: Two long parallel wires, each in the plane of the page, are separated by a distance <math alttext="3 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>d</mi></math>, as shown. The top wire carries current <math alttext="4 I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>I</mi></math> directed to the right, and the bottom wire carries current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> directed to the left. Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is also in the plane of the page, located a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> above the bottom wire. Which of the following correctly represents the magnitude of the magnetic field due to the wires at Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half times the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, times I, over pi d, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="three fourths times the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, times I, over pi d, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="three halves times the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, times I, over pi d, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="five halves times the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, times I, over pi d, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="three halves times the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, times I, over pi d, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>d</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>
